Item.Line: The hall is full of practice room. You feel like you are surrounded by music.
Let's see if my students have been practicing lately...
Frederic leads you to a room upstairs. A string trio is playing Ravel's Bolero inside. You stand there and listen for a while.
hmm... not bad, but something is not right.
For some reason our Bolero just does not sound good even though we can play all the notes perfectly...

I am glad that you girls have realized music is more than just hitting the correct notes. For a piece like Bolero, effective dynamics control is crucial to demonstrating the genius of Ravel's orchestration...
Wait wait!! I don't think I understand...
How do we know when to change dynamics?
And how do we make sure we are all doing it at the same time?
This reminds me! We have a guest today... meet player! Player, if you don't mind, can you conduct the girls and show them the right way of performing Bolero?
